page.title: 01GAZETTEER-BARNOLDSWICK
page.content: Our block includes about half the town of Barnoldswick and the rural area to the south-west. Barnoldswick is a small industrial town in north-east Lancashire with a population of around 9,000 people.Once a cotton town,many of the old cotton mills now house new industries such as plastics,light engineering,filters,and printing.The two largest employers are Rolls Royce Aero Engines and Silentnight Bedding Manufactures. The countryside round about consists of rolling hills and green meadows, split into fields by hedges and dry stone walls.The dominant feature in our block is Weets Hill which is just under 1,300 feet high.
